summary: This is a grand jury transcript from March 29, 2021, in the Southern District of New York, concerning the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. An NYPD detective assigned to the FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force testifies about the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell, detailing allegations from multiple victims, evidence from flight logs, property searches, and Maxwell's prior deposition testimony.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central defendant in the grand jury proceeding. The detective testifies about her romantic and professional relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, her role in recruiting and grooming underage girls, and her alleged participation in sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier. The detective details his properties, private jet, pattern of grooming and sexually abusing underage girls, and his relationship with Maxwell.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD Detective / FBI Task Force Officer
persons.context: The testifying witness. An NYPD detective assigned to the FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force who has been investigating Epstein and Maxwell since approximately 2017.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Another investigator on the case whose prior grand jury testimony from June 29, 2020, is read into the record. Works on the Violent Crimes Against Children's Squad.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: One of Epstein's former pilots in the 1990s. Interviewed by investigators and remembered a victim travelling on the jet but not specific dates.

connections.description: Had a romantic relationship in the 1990s; Maxwell also worked for Epstein managing his homes and staff. Described as one of his closest associates who participated in recruiting and grooming underage girls for sexual abuse.
The detective is a law enforcement officer investigating Maxwell's alleged crimes, having interviewed witnesses and reviewed evidence related to her conduct.
Rodgers was a pilot for Epstein's private jet in the 1990s.
Both are members of the federal task force investigating Epstein and Maxwell. The detective references the Special Agent's prior grand jury testimony.

events.title: Epstein and Maxwell meet Victim 1 at Interlochen
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell meet a 13/14-year-old girl (Victim 1) at the Interlochen summer arts camp in Michigan. Epstein was a donor to the camp. Flight logs corroborate their travel to Traverse City, MI, in August 1994.

events.title: Period of sexual abuse of multiple victims
events.description: Multiple victims (referred to as Victim 1, 2, 3, and Minor Victim 4) describe being groomed and sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein, often with Ghislaine Maxwell's involvement in recruitment, scheduling, and sometimes participation.

events.title: Palm Beach Police search Epstein's residence
events.description: Police execute a search warrant at Epstein's Palm Beach home (358 El Brillo Way). They seize massage tables, sex toys, and photographs, including one signed by a victim.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition testimony
events.description: Maxwell gives sworn deposition testimony in a civil defamation lawsuit. She denies knowledge of any scheme to recruit underage girls, denies giving massages, and denies awareness of sex toys at Epstein's propertiesâ€”statements contradicted by witness testimony and evidence presented to the grand jury.

events.title: FBI search of Epstein's New York townhouse
events.description: The FBI executes a search warrant at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse (9 East 71st Street). They find a massage room containing a massage table, oils, a vibrator, handcuffs, a whip, nude photographs, and a school-girl outfit in an adjacent room.

events.title: Grand jury testimony
events.description: An NYPD detective testifies before a grand jury about the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, presenting evidence from victim interviews, flight logs, property records, and prior legal proceedings.

locations: United States Courthouse, Foley Square, New York, New York
9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's townhouse)
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's estate)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico (Epstein's ranch)
Interlochen Center for the Arts, Michigan
457 Madison Avenue, New York, New York (Epstein's office/sender address)
keyFacts: The detective testifies that Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein had a romantic relationship in the 1990s and she was one of his closest associates, managing his homes.

Multiple victims (referred to by pseudonyms or as Victim 1, 2, 3, and Minor Victim 4) describe being groomed as minors by Epstein and Maxwell, with Maxwell playing a key role in recruitment, scheduling appointments, normalizing sexual behavior, and sometimes directly participating.
Flight logs for Epstein's private jet show flights with underage victims and Ghislaine Maxwell as passengers, corroborating victim accounts of travel to New York, New Mexico, and the Virgin Islands.
Searches of Epstein's properties in 2005 (Palm Beach) and 2019 (New York) uncovered massage rooms, sex toys, nude photographs, and a school-girl outfit, consistent with victim descriptions.

Ghislaine Maxwell's 2016 deposition testimony, where she denied knowledge of underage recruitment, giving massages, and awareness of sex toys, is presented and contradicted by the evidence and witness accounts summarized in the detective's testimony.
